thread.title: RIVERSIDE: Police seek help in finding armed robber
thread.title_full: RIVERSIDE: Police seek help in finding armed robber - Press Enterprise

author: PETER SUROWSKI
title: RIVERSIDE: Police seek help in finding armed robber
text:
BY PETER SUROWSKI / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 10, 2015 Updated: 9:56 p.m. RIVERSIDE: Police seek help in finding armed robber Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Police are looking for this man who was caught on video on Sept. 13, 2015, robbing a USA Gasoline station in the 4900 block of Van Buren Boulevard in Riverside. Related article Â» Investigators asked for the public's help Friday, Oct. 9, in finding a man who robbed a Riverside gas station.
The suspect walked into a USA Gasoline station in the 4900 block of Van Buren Boulevard about 11:30 p.m. Sept. 13, went behind the counter, pulled out some type of sharp object and told the employee he would stick her in the neck if she did not open the register, Riverside police said in an announcement.
The woman opened the drawer, and the man grabbed the cash and ran off, police said.
He was described as black with black and gray hair and brown eyes. He stood about 6-foot-3, weighed about 200 pounds and appeared about 50 years old, the announcement said.
He was wearing tan pants and a black jacket with an unknown logo on the left chest. He had black shoes with white soles and laces and a red baseball cap with gold lettering.
Police asked anybody with information to call 951-353-7105.
Contact the writer: psurowski@pe.com, 951-368-9548, follow him on Twitter at @PeterSurowski and like him on Facebook.
